results.title: Geography of South America: Argentina, Paraguay, Uraguay
results.brief_description: The geographic factors influencing the economy and life of Argentina, Paraguay and Uruguay, pointing out that the three nations of the Plata-Parana River system are rich in flat and rolling lands suitable for farming and grazing. Some of the achievements and problems of these countries are also discussed.

results.title: Geography of Australia
results.brief_description: A detailed examination of the geography of Australia; surrounding oceans; its area, rainfall and wind systems resulting in various climatic regions, temperature variations; main mineral resources and the uses to which these resources are put; chief rural industries. Commentary by David Low.

results.title: Gentlemen prefer blondes (Captioned)
results.creator_credit: Sol Siegel, Twentieth Century-Fox Film Corporation and Howard Hawks
results.brief_description: Two showgirls go to Paris in search of rich husbands in this musical comedy which is memorable for the score and songs such as “Diamonds are a girl’s best friend” Starring Marilyn Monroe, Jane Russel and Charles Coburn. Based on the novel by Anita Loos.

results.title: Genre
results.brief_description:
A short created by a student for the 2004 ACMI Diegesis secondary school media festival.
A day in the life of a blocked screenwriter. A film producer is harassing a screenwriter who is suffering major problems trying to come up with a script for his next movie. This short film visually depicts the film scenarios this writer conjures up - a mystery and gangster style thriller. Neither of these stories satisfy the frustrated screenwriter, and so he ends up writing a simple love story between two ordinary people. Finally he finishes the script and rushes to the post box to send his script to the producer. Upon arriving at the letter box, he meets the woman of his dreams. His screenwriting dreams become a reality.

results.title: Genetics: past, present and future (TEFC)
results.creator_credit: Rodger Jones, Open University and BBC-TV
results.brief_description: This film is concerned with the origin of the science of genetics and reconstructs some of the crucial experiments performed. It also shows how nowadays it is possible to produce entirely novel plants by manipulations that avoid sexual hybridisation. Introduced by Jonathon Hodge.

results.title: Genetics: Mendel's law
results.brief_description: Duplicates some of Mendel’s experiments with pea plants, and explains his laws of segregation, independent assortment and dominance. Describes later work by De Vries, Correns, Morgan and Muller. Suitable for upper secondary level.

results.title: Genetics and plant breeding
results.creator_credit: Peter Bradford, World Wide Pictures, Unilever Films and David Morphet
results.brief_description: Mendel’s laws of inheritance, and how the passage of the dominant and recessive characteristics from one generation to another depends on discrete particles of matter, particles which are now known to be genes on the chromosomes in the cell nucleus. It shows how the principles of genetics are applied to produce new varieties of plants.
